column4: In reality, there should only be one Arisen in the world Have you ever heard such a story? If so... what will happen from now on?

column3:
樹内への侵入者という意味では
我々も、魔物もそれほど違わない
もし、ウィルミアに攻撃されたら――
そうだな、全力で逃げるのが得策だろう
column4: In terms of intruders into the forest, both us and the enemy are not much different. If we are attacked by Willmia-- Yeah, it would be best to escape with all our strength.

column3:
だったら遠慮することはない
思う存分魔物と戦ってくれ
column4: In that case, there's no need to hold back. Fight monsters to your heart's content.

column3:
《滅びの渦》に《黒剣》、《黒竜》ね――
この酒場にいるといろいろな噂を聞くが
これほどまでに“ただの噂”であってほしいと
願ったことはないよ
column4: In the "Vortex of Ruin," there is the "Black Sword" and the "Black Dragon"... When you are in this tavern, you hear various rumors, But I have never wished for them to be more than "just rumors."

column3: 結局はそれが近道になるだろうよ
column4: In the end, that will probably be the shortcut.

column3:
王子は結局のところ
甘やかされて育ったお坊ちゃま――
そんなところかね
column4: In the end, the prince was raised as a spoiled brat-- I suppose that's how it goes.

column3:
結局これは過去との戦いだったというわけか――
いや、ずっと続いていたわけだから
まだ過去にはなっていない――
column4: In the end, this was a battle with the past, so to speak―― No, because it has been continuing for a long time, it has not become the past yet――

column3:
訓練による意思統一も難しい状況の中で
人々を鼓舞するのは勝利そのものが持つ力に他ならず
column4: In the midst of a difficult situation where it is also challenging to achieve unity through training, the ability to inspire people lies solely in the power that victory itself holds.

column3:
殺し合いの最中に――
笑わせてくれるわ
column4: In the midst of the killing, You make me laugh.

column3:
貴方が過去のアッカーシェランにて
《石碑の試練》に立ち向かい
石碑に封じられた力を解放することで
大地も悪しき竜力に対抗することができるでしょう
column4: In the past at Acre Selund, you confronted the trial of the "Stone Monument" and by unlocking the power sealed within the stone monument, the land will be able to oppose the malevolent Dragon Force.

column3:
英霊などと祀られたところで
こうしてお主のように力となってくれる者を
待ち受けるのが関の山――
わしも再び、軍を率いて戦いたかったものだ
column4: In the place where heroes and others are enshrined, I await the arrival of someone like you, who will become my strength. This is the pinnacle of our encounter— I too wanted to lead an army and fight once again.

column3:
どの辺りでどの素材がとれて、どんな敵が
出るかはテル村の覚者、アルフレドさんが
詳しいですよ
このハイデルでは
column4: In this area, Tel Village's Arisen, Mr. Alfred, is very knowledgeable about where and what materials can be obtained, as well as the types of enemies that appear.

column3: さすがは覚者サマ、といったところだな
column4: Indeed, as expected of an Arisen.

column3: 黒騎士対策が急務ってところですかね
column4: Is countermeasures against the Black Knight the urgent matter here?

column3:
それほど交わりの薄い人なのでしょうか――
もう一度会えれば――話せれば――
column4: Is he such a distant person to me - If I could see him again - If I could talk to him -

column3: 全部終わったんだよね？
column4: Is it all finished?

column3:
もう終わったの？
さすが、頼りになるね！
column4: Is it already over? As expected, you're dependable!

column3:
気にしすぎですかね――
やっぱり、ビビってるんですかね
column4: Is it because I'm worrying too much - Am I just being scared after all?

column3:
やっぱり水が多いからなのかしら？
ね、船の上で深呼吸してみて
きっと気持ちがいいわ
column4: Is it because there is a lot of water after all? Well, try taking a deep breath on the boat. It will surely feel good.

column3: ここにいてもいいの？
column4: Is it okay if I stay here?

column3:
展望城に移らなくても良いのだろうか
わたしが必要ではないのだろうか
column4: Is it okay not to move to Lookout Castle? Am I not needed?

column3:
覚者様ほどの方でも
後悔されることって、あるんでしょうか？
column4: Is it possible that even someone as wise as you would regret it?

column3:
レスタニアの覚者か
どうかしたか？
column4: Is it the Arisen of Lestania? Is there something wrong?

column3:
絶望の大陸アッカーシェランか
でもよ、あのジリアンの目には
光があったよな
column4: Is it the Land of Despair, Acre Selund? But you know, in Gillian's eyes, there was light, wasn't there?

column3:
第二のアークにイリスが現れたってのは
本当なのか？
いったい何をしていたんだ？
column4: Is it true that Iris appeared in the second Ark? What on earth was she doing?

column3:
角が珍しい？
触ってもいいよ
column4: Is it unusual to have horns? You can touch if you want.

column3: 何か無いかなぁ？
column4: Is there anything?

column3: 牢に何かご用でしょうか？
column4: Is there something you need at the prison?

column3:
ここにあった土砂か？
――恐らく、衝撃で吹き飛んでいったようだ
この先で土埃になって舞い散ってるんじゃないか？
column4: Is this the sand and soil that was here? It seems like it was blown away by the impact. Could it be turning into dust and scattering ahead?

column3:
白竜様以外の竜の覚者と一緒に戦うなんて
こんな機会はもうないかもしれませんよね？
column4: Isn't it unlikely to ever have the opportunity to fight alongside any dragon's Arisen other than the White Dragon?

column3:
人でも魔物でも構わねえ
その気になりゃいつでも大騒ぎできる程度に
相手がいるのがいいんだ
column4: It doesn't matter if they're human or monsters. It's good to have someone to make a big fuss with, whenever we feel like it.

column3: なんか“チーム”って感じだよね？
column4: It feels like a 'team,' you know?

column3:
今は天職って感じ
ま、仕事じゃないけどね
column4: It feels like my calling from heaven now. Well, it's not really a job though.

column3:
ジョゼフ様から聞く話に隊長が登場するようになって
どれくらい経つか忘れましたけど――
column4: It has been some time since Captain made their debut, or so it feels, as I heard from Sir Joseph. But I can't exactly remember how long ago it was.

column3:
おぬしたちのような戦士たちとともに戦えるのは
武人の誉れ、喜びだ
column4: It is an honor and joy to fight alongside warriors like us. Soldiers.

column3:
自分が無知であることを知るのは難しいことだ
「己の無知を知っている」と思うこと自体が
そうでないことの証明かも知れないだろう
column4: It is difficult to know that one is ignorant. Thinking "I know my own ignorance" might be evidence that it is not so.

column3:
王子がお立場を棄てることは考えられない
わたしはただただ王子を信じるのみです
column4: It is inconceivable that the prince would abandon his position. I only believe in him!

column3:
実に歯がゆい
わしらはこの場を離れることができぬ
column4: It is truly frustrating. We are unable to leave this place.

column3: この先は１人で進むにはとても危険です――（仮）
column4: It is very dangerous to go on alone ahead.

column3:
立場上不謹慎な発言かもしれんが
世のこういう状況はけして嫌いではないのだ
貴殿なら、わかるだろう？
column4: It may be inappropriate for me to say this from my standpoint, but I don't dislike this kind of situation in the world. You know what I mean, don't you?

column3: 魔物の一種かもしれねえぞ
column4: It might be a type of monster.

column3: 国が潰えるのって、一瞬なのね
column4: It only takes a moment for a country to crumble.

column3:
これ以上、ご迷惑をおかけするのが
心苦しくって――
column4: It pains me to cause you any more trouble.

column3:
貴殿はまるで竜を救うために
生まれてきたようだな
いやいや、深い意味はない
column4: It seems as though you were born to save dragons. No, no, there is no deeper meaning.

column3:
頼もしいことのように思えるが
皆、危機を身近に感じているということでもある
いったい、これからどうなるんだろうな
column4: It seems like a reliable thing to do, but it also means that everyone is feeling the crisis close at hand. I wonder what in the world is going to happen now?

column3: 予断を許さない状況のようだね
column4: It seems like a situation that doesn't allow for any speculation.

column3:
なんだかみんな落ち着いちゃってさ
いいのかな
column4: It seems like everyone has calmed down. Is it okay?

column3: ここに来て解放軍を増強できそうなんだ
column4: It seems like we can strengthen the Liberation Army by coming here.

column3:
隊長であったベイジルが行方不明となったことによる
繰り上げ式の昇格だったようだが――
元よりあの粘り強さと統率力だ
戦乱が起こらずとも、いずれは評価されていただろう
column4: It seems that it was an early promotion due to the disappearance of the captain, Basil, but he had the tenacity and leadership skills to begin with. Even without the war, he would have been recognized at some point.

column3: 王都の攻略は失敗に終わったそうですね
column4: It seems that the capture of the royal capital ended in failure.

column3:
“悪しき竜”と対峙したことで王子はどうやら
気持ちが大きくなっているようだ
column4: It seems that the prince is feeling better after confronting the "evil dragon."

column3: 借りを返すときが来たようだね
column4: It seems that the time has come to repay the debt.

column3:
貴殿はイリスと親しかったようだが――
覚悟しておいた方が良さそうだ
column4: It seems that you were close with Iris, but it's better to be prepared.

column3:
あなたに協力することが
王家のためになるはずですもの
さぁ、邪魔な土砂は吹っ飛ばしてしまいましょう
column4: It should be beneficial for the royal family for me to assist you. Now, let's blow away that obstruction.

column3: しばらく兵の増強は難しいだろう
column4: It will be difficult to reinforce the troops for a while.

column3:
王都メガドの奪回は簡単ではないだろう
でも、今の解放軍ならやれる気がする
column4: It won't be easy to reclaim the Royal Capital of Megado, but I feel like the Liberation Army can do it now.

column3:
彼女との付き合いが長い
レオに任せるのが一番だな
column4: It'd be best to leave it to Leo, who has a long history with her.

column3: 任務は任務だからな
column4: It's a mission, after all.

column3:
王家ゆかりの地であるのに、番人が
自分一人なのはそのせいですね――
column4: It's a place associated with the royal family, but that's why there's only one guardian.

column3:
せっかくだ
メガドを観光していってほしいところだが
まずは任務を終えてからだな
column4: It's a shame. I would like you to visit Megado as a tourist, but first, you should finish the mission.

column3:
狭いところだけど、旅人さん用の寝床もあるの
お代として<VAL PRICE_INN>もらうけど
いいかしら？
column4: It's a small place, but there is a sleeping space for travelers as well. I will take <VAL PRICE_INN> as payment, is that okay with you?

column3:
変な話だけど、ここってなぜだか
ゴブリンがウロウロしてるんだ
column4: It's a strange story, but for some reason, there are goblins wandering around here.

column3:
全てはあなた次第
暗き道を切り開かれますよう――
column4: It's all up to you. May you make your way through the dark.

column3:
全てはあなた次第
暗き道を切り開かれますよう――
column4: It's all up to you. May you make your way through the dark.

column3:
こんな時代なのに商品が行き来しているのは
凄いことだ――
俺たち、誇っていいと思うぞ
column4: It's amazing how much product is coming and going in these times-- I think we should all be proud!

column3:
すごいよ、この火――
ここにあっても、火事にならないんだって
とっても暖まるね！
column4: It's amazing, this fire. I heard that even if it's here, it won't cause a fire. It's really warm!

column3: みなさんとご一緒できて光栄です
column4: It's an honor to be here with you all.

column3:
昔からの習慣だ
覚悟だけはしておこう
column4: It's an old habit. Let's just be prepared.

column3:
刺激だぜ、刺激
俺が欲しいのはそれだ――やっとわかった
column4: It's exciting, so exciting. That's what I want―― I finally understand.

column3: ココにいる、楽しイ！
column4: It's fun being here!

column3:
いつどこで侵食魔の
襲撃を受けるやらわからぬ
――気が抜けないというのも辛いな
column4: It's hard to know when and where the Corruption will strike --and it's hard not to be distracted.

column3: 親鳥が先か卵が先か――みたいな話ですけどね
column4: It's like the chicken and the egg problem, you know.

column3:
人をジジイ扱いする若造に手厳しく仕返しするのが
わしの楽しみでな
column4: It's my pleasure to give a harsh retaliation to the young people who treat me like an old man.

column3:
知識が増える、といったことじゃない
お前の目はたくさんの世界を見ることになる――
そう、何かを追い求める限りな
column4: It's not about gaining knowledge, Your eyes will see many worlds— Yes, as long as you pursue something.

column3: ダメですよね、こういうこと考えちゃ
column4: It's not good, thinking about things like that.

column3:
人が武器を選ぶばかりではなく――
時として、武器が人を選ぶこともありましょう
column4: It's not only humans who choose weapons - Sometimes, weapons also choose their wielders.

column3: だいじょうぶ――だいじょうぶだよ
column4: It's okay... It's okay.

column3: 話しかけてくるなんて珍しいね
column4: It's rare for someone to come and talk to me like this.

column3:
不思議です
不安だし、焦りもあるんですけど
column4: It's strange and I feel uneasy and anxious, but.

column3:
面倒をかけているわたしが言うのも変ですけど――
時々休んでくださいね
column4: It's strange for someone like me who is causing trouble to say it, but please take occasional rests.

column3: 騒ぎになると面倒だな
column4: It's troublesome when it becomes a commotion.

column3:
面倒だな――おまえの手で
過去にしてやるといい
column4: It's troublesome... It would be good for you to make a thing of the past with your own hands.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: It's unbearable that the demons are increasing like this.

column3:
お主にかかっておるのだぞ
そんな装備で送り出すわけにはゆかぬ
もう少し自覚をだな――
column4: It's up to you. I can't send you off with such equipment. Have a little more awareness—

column3:
ジョゼフとクラウスの意見は対立し――
白竜は相変わらずまどろみの中――
column4: Joseph and Klaus have conflicting opinions - The White Dragon remains in a deep slumber.

column3:
攻撃を受ける直前、敵の体重がかかる
わずかな瞬間を見定めろ
column4: Just before receiving an attack, determine the moment when the enemy's weight is applied.

column3: ここだけの話――
column4: Just between you and me...

column3: もう少しだけ時間をくれないか――（仮）
column4: Just give me a little more time.

column3: もう少しだけ時間をくれないか――（仮）
column4: Just give me a little more time.

column3: もう少しだけ時間をくれないか――（仮）
column4: Just give me a little more time.

column3:
言っておくけどね
あたしが盗むのは王家のお宝だけさ
column4: Just so you know I only steal royal treasures.

column3:
この先平和になったらでいいんです
いつか、レスタニアのことを教えてください
column4: Just when there's peace down the road. Someday, please tell us about Lestania.

column3: キッ　キッ
column4: Kch Kch.

column3:
殺す、ただ殺す
それが世界だ
column4: Kill, just kill. That's how the world works.

column3: 身の程を知れ
column4: Know your place.

column3: キャーーッ！
column4: Kyaa!

column3:
リズ様、もう少し
そそっかしさをあらためて下されば――
column4: Lady Lise, if you could please be a little more attentive—

column3:
ここのところ戦いに出る日が続いて
なかなか武具の手入れができないのが、な――
戦場で壊れでもしたら、終わりだ
column4: Lately, I have been going out to battle for consecutive days and it's been difficult to maintain my equipment, ah— If it were to break on the battlefield, it would be the end.

column3:
最近は変なことばかり――
これから一体どうなるんだろうね――
column4: Lately, there have been nothing but strange things happening - I wonder what will happen from now on.

column3: 近頃はなかなか厄介な事件が増えてきたな
column4: Lately, there have been quite a few troublesome incidents.

column3:
侵食魔退治は俺に任せろ
ガシガシやっつけておくぜ
column4: Leave the eradication of the Corruption to me. I'll take care of it, no problem.

column3:
あと少しですよ、隊長
《原始の雫》が芯なる樹を――
ひいてはこのフィンダムを浄化してくれます
column4: Left: just a little more, Captain. The "Primeval Drops" will cleanse the core tree- and in turn, cleanse Phindym for us.

column3:
レオが恐い顔をしていたの――
ちょっとびっくりしちゃった
column4: Leo had a scary look on his face— I was a little surprised.

column3:
レオはいい奴だ
付き合いが浅くても、それだけはわかるよ
column4: Leo is a good guy. Even though we don't know each other well, that much is clear.

column3:
レオはやっぱりわたしたちのことを考えていて
くれたんだよね
column4: Leo is still thinking about us. He protected us.

column3:
レオはよ――バカだよな
冷めた顔して、熱くなりすぎるんだ
あいつは昔からそうだったぜ
column4: Leo is such an idiot, isn't he? He always looks calm, but he gets too heated. He has been like that since forever.

column3: レスタニア者は一筋縄ではいかないね
column4: Lestania citizens are not easy to deal with.

column3:
レスタニアはまた大変なことになりましたけど――
そのおかげで隊長と一緒に働けて――
column4: Lestania is in trouble again, but— that allowed me to work with the captain and—

column3:
レスタニアも同じだろうけど
このアッカーシェランにも長い歴史があってね――
column4: Lestania is probably the same but Acre Selund also has a long history—

column3: レスタニアの人よ、なんなりと
column4: Lestania's people, anything you want.

column3:
レスタニア――
不思議な響きだな
新鮮な感じがするよ
column4: Lestania— It has a mysterious sound, It feels fresh.

column3:
数々の者へ示した輝かしきその力
この目にも感じさせてくれ
“アッカーシェランの記憶”でのことは
ここから全て見守っている
column4: Let it be known to many, that splendid power. Let it be felt by these eyes. Within the memory of Acre Selund, I watch over everything from here.

column3: 任務に集中させてくれ
column4: Let me concentrate on the mission.

column3: 呑ませてくれ――
column4: Let me drink—

column3:
ゲートのことはわたしに任せてください
どんなに時間がかかっても
皆さんを必ずフィンダムにご招待します
column4: Let me take care of the gate. No matter how long it takes, I promise to bring you all to Phindym!

column3:
お前には一足先に教えておこう
前人未踏の場所を探索してみたければ
今が絶好の機会だぞ！
column4: Let me tell you in advance; If you want to explore uncharted territory, now is a great opportunity!

column3:
ここを、全ての古きものの終の地としよう
そして新たに、世界を描き変えるのだ
column4: Let this be the end of all that is old and let us redraw the world anew!

column3: お互い、油断せずいきましょう
column4: Let's both be careful and not let our guard down.

column3: この状況、俺たちで変えて見せましょう！
column4: Let's change this situation, and show what we can do!

column3:
黒騎士を倒して白竜様の力と
メガドを取り戻しましょう！
column4: Let's defeat the Black Knight and restore the power of the White Dragon and Megado!

column3: さっさと済ませるぞ
column4: Let's finish it quickly.

column3:
早く集落を目指しましょう
何より、森の中は安全とは言えません
column4: Let's get to the village as soon as possible. Above all, it is not safe in the forest!

column3: それじゃあ行こう！
column4: Let's go then!

column3: ああ、用件を聞こうか
column4: Let's hear what you have to say.

column3: 急ぐぞ、嫌な予感がする――
column4: Let's hurry, I have a bad feeling—

column3:
封鎖を解いておこう
一度行ってみてくれ
column4: Let's lift the blockade; Please go and see for yourself.

column3: 竜に選ばれし者の活躍――見せてもらうぞ
column4: Let's see what the dragon's chosen one can do.

column3: 暮らしは厳しくなる一方だよ
column4: Life is getting tougher.

column3: 暮らしは厳しくなる一方だよ
column4: Life keeps getting tougher.

column3: ――人生の巡り合わせは不思議だよな
column4: Life's encounters are strange, aren't they?

column3:
リズと俺――ある意味、敵同士ですよね
どっちが隊長の信頼を勝ち取るか――みたいな
column4: Lise and me—In a way, we are enemies, aren't we? It's like, who will earn the captain's trust?

column3: リズ、もう聞こえていないみたい――
column4: Lise, I don't think he can hear me anymore—

column3: リズはああ見えて、かなりしっかりした子だね
column4: Lise, believe it or not, is a pretty reliable girl.

column3: よいか、本人には内緒だぞ
column4: Listen, it's a secret from them.

column3:
自由に生きるってのは
思ったほど楽じゃないんだな、これが
column4: Living free is not as easy as I thought it would be.

column3:
ロイグは、わたしたちが看病したり
治療のために奔走するのが不思議で
たまらないみたい
column4: Loeg seems to find it fascinating and irresistible that we take care of him and go all out for his treatment.

column3:
黒騎士が来た時、ロイグは勇敢だったよね
見直しちゃったな
column4: Loeg was brave when the Black Knight came. It made me reassess him.

column3: ロイグのしたことは許せないけど――
column4: Loeg's actions are unforgivable, but—

column3:
展望城に自分の部屋はないのかって？
ああ、それなら以前
一度作ってもらったことがあってね
column4: Lookout Castle, isn't there a room for me there? Ah, well, it's because I had one made before.

column3: レスタニアの覚者か――
column4: Lord Arisen of Lestania—

column3:
覚者さま！
お噂はかねがね――
column4: Lord Arisen! I have always heard rumors about you—

column3:
覚者さま！？
装備品をお間違えではないでしょうか――
column4: Lord Arisen!? Your equipment, could it be a mistake—

column3:
覚者さま、恐れながら
リズ様のお手伝いをお頼みします
column4: Lord Arisen, I'm afraid I need Lady Lise's help...

column3:
覚者様、申し訳ありませんが
そのような武具で内部に進まれるのは
かなり危険かと――
column4: Lord Arisen, I'm sorry but it is quite dangerous to proceed inside with such weaponry.

column3:
ローナやブラッド――
それに砦の兵隊さんまで
大食堂の修復手伝ってくれてるんだよ！
column4: Lorna and Brad, and even the soldiers in the fort, are helping with the restoration work!

column3: 多くの民は――強くはありません
column4: Many of the people... They are not strong.

column3:
覚者サマってのは
意外と気取らないもんなんだな
column4: Master Arisen is surprisingly unpretentious

column3:
覚者様――申し訳ございません
すでに本日の《復活力》の加護を受けられています
加護を受けられるのは１日に１度だけなのです
column4:
Master Arisen, I apologize.
You have already received today's blessing of "Revival Power".
You can only receive the blessing once a day.

column3:
覚者様――申し訳ございません
すでに本日の《復活力》の加護を受けられています
加護を受けられるのは１日に１度だけなのです
column4:
Master Arisen, I apologize.
You have already received today's blessing of "Revival Power".
You can only receive the blessing once a day.

column3:
白竜に選ばれし覚者様――
古の武器についてであれば、お力になれるかと
column4: Master Arisen, chosen by the White Dragon - If it's about ancient weapons, I can be of assistance.

column3: 覚者さま、何かご用でしょうか？
column4: Master Arisen, do you have any business with me?

column3:
覚者さま、お仕事頑張ってね！
いつでも待ってるわ
column4:
Master Arisen, good luck with your work!
I'll always be waiting.

column3: 覚者さま、ご機嫌いかがですか
column4: Master Arisen, how are you feeling today?

column3: あら覚者さま、ご機嫌いかがですか？
column4: Master Arisen, how are you feeling today?

column3:
覚者殿、今回のミッションについては
私からご説明を！
column4: Master Arisen, let me explain about the mission this time!

column3: ご用でしょうか、覚者様
column4: May I help you, Master Arisen

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3: あなたの旅によき導きがありますように
column4: May you have a good guidance on your journey

column3:
もうさ、わたしは戦うの専門でいいかも
腕を磨いて、口出ししないで
ひたすら戦うよ
column4:
Maybe I'll just specialize in fighting
and keep my skills sharp and stay out of the way
I'll just fight.

column3:
メイリーフはすでに“一族”を失っています
これ以上恐ろしい思いをさせたくはないのに――
column4: Mayleaf has already lost her 'family' and I don't want to make her suffer anymore—

column3: メイリーフにご用でしょうか？
column4: Mayleaf, can I help you?

column3:
メガドは、ずいぶん華やかに見えるだろう？
その代わり、あたしやメフィスみたいなはぐれ者は
隅に追いやられてるのさ
column4: Megado looks pretty glamorous, doesn't it? Instead, outcasts like me and Mephis are relegated to the corner.

column3:
モルは少し変わったところがあるでしょう？
人の話をあまり聞いていないように見えたり
なぜかいつもお腹を空かせていたり――
column4: Moles are a little different, aren't they? It seems like they don't listen to people's stories much and they're always hungry for some reason—

column3: モォ～～～
column4: Mooo~

column3:
道具の多くは、クラフトの
アイテム生産で作ることができる
ポーン持ちの覚者さんならな
すぐ手に入れたきゃ買ったほうが早いぞ
column4: Most of the tools can be crafted through the production of crafts. If you're an Arisen with a Pawn, it is faster to buy it if you want to get it quickly.

column3:
相互理解など凡夫の夢――
愚かなことよ
column4: Mutual understanding is an ordinary man's dream— It's foolishness.

column3: 行動が愚かだが――昔からだ
column4: My actions may be foolish, but it has always been this way.

column3: 血がよ、ザワザワと沸くようだぜ
column4: My blood is boiling, man.

column3:
娘から色々と聞いたが――
わたしも一度はレスタニアを見たいものだ
column4: My daughter has told me so much about it— I wish I could see Lestania at least once.

column3:
私の故郷は離れていますし
小さいながらも守りの固い城に
住んでおりますから、家族も無事ですよ
column4: My hometown is far away. And even though it is small, it is a securely fortified castle, So my family is safe.

column3:
わたしの希望はね――
次の火竜を見たいということです
column4: My hope is— to see the next fire dragon!

column3:
あたしの仕事かい？
情報屋、古道具屋、胴元――
数えだしたらキリが無いねェ
column4: My job? Informer, antique dealer, bookmaker— the list goes on and on.

column3: わしの人生はもう夕暮れ時だ
column4: My life is already in its twilight.

column3:
母に逃げてって言われたんです
それでここまで来たんです――
column4: My mother told me to run away, so I came here...

column3:
わたしなりの哲学だが、理解者は少ない
おまえはどうだ？
column4: My own philosophy, but few people understand it. What about you?

column3:
わたしの両親は性格が昼と夜――空と海ほどに
性格が違う人たちだった
column4: My parents were people whose personalities were as different as night and day— as different as the sky and the sea.

column3:
ミシアルが現れたと聞いています
わたしも会いたかったですよ
column4: Mysial has appeared, I heard. I wanted to meet her, too.

column3:
ミシアルが自ら闇に身を投げ――
誘拐犯たるイリスはレオが討伐した
そのレオは神殿に戻っていない――
column4: Mysial threw herself into darkness— Iris, the kidnapper, was defeated by Leo. But Leo has not returned to the temple—

column3:
ミシアルとこのあたりを歩いたって本当？
どうしてうちに寄ってくれなかったの！？
column4: Mysial, is it true that you walked around this area? Why didn't you come visit me?

column3:
しっかし、魔物ってのは尽きないよな
こいつらいったい何のためにいるんだとか
テツガク的なことも考えたくなるぜ
column4: Nevertheless, enemies never seem to run out, you know? I wonder what they're actually here for. It makes me want to think about it from a philosophical perspective.

column3: よろしくお願いします！
column4: Nice to meet you!

column3: よく来たね
column4: Nice to see you

column3: よく来たね
column4: Nice to see you

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
言い訳はなしだ、そんなもん考える前に
手と足を動かせよ
column4: No excuses, move your hands and feet before thinking about that.

column3:
いくら事前に完璧に計画したつもりでも
その場の状況でいくらだって変わるし
思い通りに行く方が珍しいくらいさ
column4: No matter how perfectly you plan it in advance, it can change at any moment, and it's rare that things go the way you want them to.

column3:
口ではなんと言おうと
奴はここでの立場――責任を捨てた男だ
このままじゃあ、スカッとしねえぞ
column4: No matter what he says, he's a man who has abandoned his position and responsibility here. If things continue like this, it won't be satisfying in the least.

column3: 慈悲などやらん、死ね
column4: No mercy, just death.

column3:
誰もかれもが仲良くやれるなんて
そんな都合のいい話はない
column4: No one can get along with everyone. It's not that convenient.

column3: 無駄話はいい、さっそく本題に入るぞ
column4: No time for idle chatter, let's get to the point.

column3: いや、考えたくもない
column4: No, I don't even want to think about it.

column3:
いえ、あなた方を悪く言うつもりはなくてね
ただ、心配なだけで――
column4: No, I don't intend to speak ill of you all. I'm just worried, that's all...

column3: なに、前はちょっと腕が鈍ってただけさ！
column4: No, I was just a little rusty before!

column3: ううん、何か話をと言われましても――
column4: No, even if you ask me to talk about something -

column3:
ううん、死んでしまった人、全員のぶん
わたしは生きるの――そう決めたの
column4: No, for all those who have died. I'm going to live - I've decided.

column3:
いや、覚者さまに自分ごときが
声をかけられるなんて、と思いましてね
column4: No, for someone like me to be approached by an Arisen, I couldn't believe it.

column3:
いや、オークならば、かろうじて通用するでしょう
しかし、悪しき竜相手では、果たして――
column4: No, if it's an Orc, it will barely work. However, when facing the Evil Dragon, I wonder if it will be effective...

column3: いいえ、そうは見えませんね――
column4: No, it doesn't look like—

column3:
ううん、やっぱり違う
レオが守ったのは
レスタニア全体の未来だよね？
column4: No, it's different after all. Leo protected the future of Lestania, right?

column3: ダメ、もうホントに無理
column4: No, it's really impossible now.

column3:
いやいや、すまない
どうも警戒が先に立ってしまってね
column4: No, no, I'm sorry. I was just being cautious, that's all.

column3:
いや、グリッテンの戦いは盛り上がったな
ついつい思い出してしまうよ
column4: No, the battle of Gritten was exciting. I can't help but reminisce about it.

column3: いや、待てよ？
column4: No, wait, could you?

column3: いや、待てよ？
column4: No, wait, could you?

column3:
本来であれば俺が向かいたいところだが
ストックしてある医療物資が
底を尽きかけていることもあって、
物資の確保が何よりの急務になってしまった
column4: Normally, I would have headed there myself, but our stock of medical supplies is running out, and securing supplies has become a matter of the utmost urgency.

column3: 獲物になりそうなのは、あまりいないな
column4: Not a lot of potential prey out there.

column3: まったく、落ち着く暇もないわね
column4: Not a moment to relax at all.

column3:
戦技の変更はもとより
《レアアイテムの鑑定》、そして
《黒呪装具の効果封印》も
わたしに心得がございます
column4: Not only can I change your combat techniques, but I also have knowledge of "Rare Item Appraisal" and "Bitterblack Equipment Effect Seal."

column3:
ここを離れることはおろか
フィンダム以外の地があることすら知りませんでした
私にとっての唯一の場所なのです
column4: Not only leaving this place, but I didn't even know that there were other places besides Phindym. It is the only place for me.

column3:
質だけじゃなく、数もきっちり揃えてあるぞ！
お前の部下たちにも遠慮なく使うよう
言っておいてくれ
column4: Not only the quantity, but also the quality is meticulous! Please tell your subordinates to use it without hesitation.

column3:
今はメガド奪回作戦の重要な局面のはず
さあ早く戻ってくれ
column4: Now is an important moment in the plan to regain Megado. Please come back quickly.

column3:
今は兵達を労い、休ませる時です
今少し、時間をください
column4: Now is the time to commend and give rest to the soldiers. Please wait a little while.

column3:
それでは――残った“力”で
そこの扉を解放することにしましょう
column4: Now then, let's use the remaining Dragon Force to unlock the door over there.

column3:
さて、あなたにはもっと深くまで
行ってもらわないとね――
column4: Now, I need you to go deeper—

column3: さぁ、何でも手伝うわよ！
column4: Now, I'll help with anything!

column3: さあ、今は早く帰った方がいい
column4: Now, it's better to go home quickly.

column3: それでは今回の任務について説明する
column4: Now, let me explain about the mission this time.

column3:
さぁ、覚者さんも何か食べましょうよ
それとも、飲みたい気分？
column4: Now, let's get you something to eat, Arisen. Or would you like something to drink?

column3: さて、帰るとしよう！
column4: Now, let's go home!

column3:
さぁ、さっそく課題を出そう
君がその一端に触れてくれることを願うよ
column4: Now, let's promptly submit the assignment. I hope you can lend a hand in that regard.

column3: さあ、早く為すべき事を！
column4: Now, quickly do what needs to be done!

column3: さぁ、今日もやるか
column4: Now, shall we do it today as well?

column3:
さぁさ、じっくり見てってよ！
あの《滅びの渦》をどうにかしに行くんだろ？
だったらなおさら、慎重に武器を選ばないとね
column4: Now, take a good look! How are we going to deal with that "Vortex of Ruin"? We better choose our weapons carefully.

column3: さて、何をする？
column4: Now, what to do?

column3: さて、何をする？
column4: Now, what to do?

column3:
さあ、生まれ変わりたいのは誰だい？
ボクが全力でリボーンさせてあげよう――
お代は<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>を頂くよ
今なら<COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_TK>でも支払いＯＫだよ！
column4: Now, who wants to be reborn? I'll fully revitalize you and bring you into a new life— The fee is <COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_GP>. If you pay now, <COL b92828><UNTN TK></COL> <VAL PRICE_REBORN_TK> is also acceptable!

column3: もちろん、ものすごく期待はしていますけど――
column4: Of course, I have really high expectations, but -

column3:
無論、それにふさわしい試練が
お主を待ち受けている
しかし、わしの見たところ――
お主ならば心配することはない
column4: Of course, a fitting ordeal awaits you but as I see it—you have nothing to worry about!

column3:
当然、侵食魔もウヨウヨしている
お前も《菌糸の襲窟》に向かう時は
抗侵薬を忘れずに持っていくようにな
column4: Of course, the infected creatures are also crawling about. When you head towards the Fungal Colony Caves, make sure to bring the Anti-Corruption Medicine with you.

column3:
もちろん勝利が全てではありませんけど
未来への道しるべになりますよね？
column4: Of course, winning isn't everything. But it's a signpost for the future, right?

column3:
――あら
魔物のわたしが話すのが珍しいですか？
column4: Oh, do you find it unusual for a monster like me to speak?

column3:
ああ忙しい
やることはいっぱいなのに
気が急いて何もできんわ！
column4: Oh, I'm so busy, I have so much to do! I'm in such a rush I can't get anything done!

column3:
あーあ
どっかにすんごいお宝、転がってないかなぁ
そしたらセルマの姐さんに見直してもらえるのに
column4: Oh dear. I wonder if there might be an amazing treasure hidden somewhere. If so, Sister Selma could take another look at it for me.

column3: おやおや、王子探しは中断ですか？
column4: Oh my, is the search for the prince on hold?

column3:
そうそう、もしロスギルに行かれた際は
翡翠湖を眺めていってくださいね
観光の目玉ですから
column4: Oh yes, if you happen to visit Rothgill, please make sure to take a look at the view of Emerald Lake. It's a popular tourist attraction.

column3:
ああ戻ったんだね
やっぱりあんたたちがいてくれないと
背中が不安だよ
column4: Oh you're back. I still need you guys. I'm worried about my back.

column3: おお、そうだな
column4: Oh, I see.

column3:
ほほう――課題を乗り越えたのか
君は白竜がかつて封じた錬金術を
覚者でありながら、学ぼうというんだね
column4: Oh, I see—have you overcome the challenge? You, as an Arisen, wish to learn the alchemy that the White Dragon once sealed away.

column3:
おや、<COL b92828>男性か女性専用のアイテム</COL>を
装備しているから、生まれ変わることはできないかな
専用の装備をはずして、またおいでよ
column4: Oh, I wonder if you can't be reborn because you're equipped with <COL b92828>a male or female exclusive item</COL>. Please take off the exclusive equipment and come again.

column3: あ、私語はちょっと――
column4: Oh, I'm sorry, I don't want to talk about—

column3:
あ、ごめんなさい
わたしじゃなくて、まず、白竜様だよね？
column4: Oh, I'm sorry. It's not me, but The White Dragon first, right?

column3: ふぅん、君が覚者ですか
column4: Oh, are you an Arisen?

column3:
おや、覚者さんかな
研究に付き合って貰って感謝しているよ
column4: Oh, are you an Arisen? I'm grateful for your assistance in my research.

column3:
あっ、いらっしゃい！
何か食べていってよ！
column4: Oh, come on in! Please have something to eat!

column3: おう、訓練について質問か？
column4: Oh, do you have any questions about the training?

column3: おお、私に何か用かね？
column4: Oh, do you need something from me?

column3: お、あたしに何か用かい？
column4: Oh, do you need something from me?

column3:
おっと、商品をみたいかい？
申し訳ない、今は準備しきれて
いないものも多くてね
column4: Oh, do you want to see the goods? I'm sorry, there are many things that haven't been fully prepared yet.

column3:
ああ、俺のことは気にしなくていい
用が無くなれば、また眠りにつくことになる
早いとこ寝かせてくれよ、ハハハ
――この国を頼んだぜ
column4: Oh, don't worry about me. When I have no more use for you, I'll go back to sleep. Let me sleep early, hahaha—I'm asking for this country, man!

column3: あら、ごきげんよう
column4: Oh, good day.

column3: おお、調子はどうだ？
column4: Oh, how are you doing?

column3: あら、ご機嫌いかがですか？
column4: Oh, how are you feeling?

column3: おう、調査の進捗はどうだ？
column4: Oh, how's the investigation going?

column3: おお、どうかしたかい？
column4: Oh, is something wrong?

column3:
おお、お主の働きによって
全ての区画が解放されたようだ！
わしの“力”の回収といい
鮮やかなる手腕であった、礼を言おう！
column4: Oh, it seems that all the sections have been liberated by your labor! And with your brilliant skill in collecting my power, I must express my gratitude!

column3:
はっ、覚者様でしたか
何のご用でしょう？
column4: Oh, it's an Arisen. What brings you here?

column3:
いやぁ、久しぶりに持つ剣は重いな
前はもうちょっと、こう――
column4: Oh, it's been a while since I held a sword. It feels heavy now. It used to be a little lighter, like...

column3:
あら、あなたのお仲間さんは
もう道を拓いているようね
column4: Oh, looks like your fellow is already blazing a trail.

column3: あれ、体が重いぞ、こんなはずじゃあ
column4: Oh, my body feels heavy. This is not how it should be.

column3: ああ、もう――だめだ――
column4: Oh, no—it's no use—

column3:
あー、ごめん
今ちょっと考えなきゃいけないことが
あってね、忙しいんだ
column4: Oh, sorry. There's something I need to think about right now. I'm busy.

column3: ああ、どうも
column4: Oh, thank you.

column3: ――ああ、なんだ？
column4: Oh, what is it?

column3: あら、どうかして？
column4: Oh, what's wrong?

column3:
へえ――なんだか見違えたな
一皮むけたってやつだ
column4: Oh, wow—something about you has really changed. It's like you've shed a whole new skin.

column3: あら、レスタニアの方ね？
column4: Oh, you're from Lestania, aren't you?

column3:
あら、レスタニアの方
河を渡りたいのかしら？
column4: Oh, you're the one from Lestania. Want to cross the river?

column3:
おう、来たな！
あらためて自己紹介しておこうか
魔赤島調査隊、隊長のベルトランだ
この島のエリアマスターも兼任している
column4: Oh, you've arrived! Let me introduce myself again. I'm Bertrand, the captain of the Bloodbane Isle research team. I'm also the Area Master of this island.

column3: おや――また来たのか
column4: Oh, you've come back again.

column3: あー、キミキミ
column4: Oh, you, you.

column3: あー、キミキミ
column4: Oh, you, you.

column3:
あれ、あんたの仲間は
すでに道を拓いてるんじゃない？
column4: Oh, your companions, aren't they already carving their own path?

column3:
あぁ――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
なるほど確かに相応の腕になったようだ
column4: Oh—you want me to train you? Well, you certainly look like you're up to snuff.

column3:
おお――顔は覚えたぞ
俺は騎士団の副長ハインツだ
今後も色々あるだろうが――よろしくな
column4: Oh—I remember your face. I am Vice Captain Heinz of the Knight Order. There will be various things happening in the future, but—please take care of me.

column3:
ほう――
私に稽古をつけてもらいたいのか？
column4: Oh... Do you want me to teach you a lesson?

column3: ひ――なんだ、話掛けるな
column4: Oh... What? Don't talk to me.

column3: ほう？　話したいというわけか
column4: Oh? So you want to talk, is that it?

column3: あれ？　何して遊ぶ？　え？　お話し？
column4: Oh? What should we play? Draw? A story?

column3:
オーケイ！　素敵に変身したいのは誰だい？
容姿のスタイリングは<COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>を頂くよ
声やポーンの口調、発言頻度の変更はサービスさ！
好きにチェンジしていくといいよ
column4: Okay! Who wants a makeover? We'll take on your styling for <COL b92828><UNTN GS></COL> <VAL PRICE_PARLOR_GP>. We'll change your voice, pawn tone, and frequency of speech as a service! You can change it up as you like!

column3:
よし、いいだろう
《ファイター》を名乗ることを許そう
column4: Okay, fine. I'll allow you to call yourself a Fighter.

column3: よし、その調子で修練を重ねろよ！
column4: Okay, keep up the practice!

column3: よし、今回の作戦について説明する
column4: Okay, let me explain about this operation.

column3:
立場上、ひいきするわけにはいかないが
私が最も愛するジョブは当然《ファイター》だ
column4: On principle, I cannot show favoritism, but my most beloved job is, of course, "Fighter."

column3:
落ち着いたらキノザのお湯に浸かって
養生するつもりです
column4: Once I get settled down, I plan to soak in the Kinoza hot spring for recuperation.

column3:
中に入ると四方八方から滝の音が聞こえて
方向感覚を失いそうになるくらいだ
調査隊では《滝鳴洞穴》と呼んでいる
column4: Once inside, you can hear the sound of the waterfall from all directions and almost lose your sense of direction. The survey team calls it "Waterfall Echo Cavern."

column3: 動き始めたものは、止められない
column4: Once something starts moving, it cannot be stopped.

column3: 工事が終わったら、来週には入口のおっさんが
column4: Once the construction is finished, the old man at the entrance will let you know next week!

column3: 工事が終わったら、来週には入口のおっさんが
column4: Once the construction is finished, the old man at the entrance will let you know next week!

column3: 工事が終わったら、来週には入口のおっさんが
column4: Once the construction is finished, the old man at the entrance will let you know next week!

column3: 工事が終わったら、来週には入口のおっさんが
column4: Once the construction is finished, the old man at the entrance will let you know next week!

column3:
引き継ぎが終わり次第わたしも神殿へ行く
向こうで会おうではないか
column4:
Once the handover is complete, I will also go to the temple.
Let's meet there, shall we?

column3:
こっちの状況が落ち着いたら
かならず訪ねていくから――
column4: Once this situation here settles down, I will definitely come to visit.

column3:
秘密の入り口が見つかったら
あとは任せてください
column4:
Once you find the secret entrance
we'll take care of the rest.

column3:
一期一会――いい言葉だね
俺、商品、客――
すべての出会いが、そうなんだな
column4:
Once-in-a-lifetime encounter――That's a nice phrase
Me, the product, the client――
Every encounter is like that

column3:
いつか、レスタニアの話を
ゆっくり聞かせてくれ
君らの手が空いた時でいい
column4: One day, when you have a moment, please take your time to tell me about Lestania.

column3:
腹いっぱい食ってこそ、
この筋肉も仕事する気になってくれるってもんよ
column4: Only if you eat a full meal will these muscles be willing to work!

column3:
白竜だけがこの世界の
すべてを知っている――
早くお話しを聞きたいですね
column4:
Only the White Dragon knows everything in this world--
I want to hear the story quickly.

column3:
おっと、君の仲間は
すでにこの先に行ったことがあるようだな
column4:
Oops, it seems like your companions
have already gone ahead.

column3:
おっと――
こんな月並みな礼をしちまうとは
あたしも歳を取ったねえ
column4: Oops-- I can't believe I'm resorting to such a clichéd gesture. I guess I'm getting old.

column3:
突破口を開いて敵陣深く入り込み
本陣をかく乱する――
ふふ、敵が驚き、呆ける顔を間近で見られるのは
《ファイター》だけだ！
column4:
Opening a breakthrough and infiltrating deep into enemy territory
Disrupting their main force -
Hehe, being able to see the surprised and bewildered faces up close
Is something only a Fighter can do!

column3: オークどもめ――
column4: Orc scum--

column3:
我々の国、アッカーシェランは
火竜様に育まれたこの大陸そのものと不離一体
――この大陸を守るため
どうかそのお力をお貸しください
column4:
Our country, Acre Selund,
is inseparable from this continent, nurtured by the Fire Dragon itself
――In order to protect this continent,
please lend us your power.

column3: 貴様らの世界観で我が遠謀深慮ははかれぬ
column4: Our cunning cannot be understood by your worldview

column3:
人は変わるね――ああ、良くも悪くも
変わるものさ
column4:
People change――Ah, for better or worse
We change

column3:
人の好みは十人十色
きっと君にピッタリのスタイルがあるはずさ
column4:
People have different preferences.
There must be a style that suits you perfectly!

column3: ふぅー
column4: Phew

column3:
ふう――覚者でいることは大変だけど
お互い、がんばりましょう
column4:
Phew - being an Arisen is tough, but
we both just have to do our best.

column3: ふぅ、私だってやればできるわ
column4: Phew, I can do it too if I try

column3: ふう、まったくお互い大変そうね
column4: Phew, both of us seem to be going through a tough time, don't we?

column3: ふう、なかなか気が休まらないよ
column4: Phew, it's hard to relax.

column3:
フィンダムは変わりつつある
暮らす者たちの意識は確実に変わっている
column4:
Phindym is changing.
The attitude of the people living here is definitely changing.

column3:
フィンダムはもうずいぶん犠牲を払ったはずだが――
まだまだ足りないのだろうか
column4:
Phindym must have sacrificed a lot already -
Is it still not enough?

column3:
深層に進む際はご注意ください
より強力な魔物が潜んでいるかもしれません――（仮）
column4: Please be careful when delving deeper. There may be more powerful enemies lurking.

column3:
先にそちらのミッションの参加予定を
取り消し、あらためてここに来てくれ
column4: Please cancel your participation in the mission over there first, and then come here again.

column3:
先にそちらのミッションの参加予定を
取り消し、あらためてここに来てくれ
column4: Please cancel your participation in the mission over there first, and then come here again.

column3: 最後まで、我々とともに歩んでくれ
column4: Please continue to walk with us, until the end

column3:
神殿の連中によろしく伝えてくれ
心の準備ができたら、わたしの方から
挨拶に行きたいと思う
column4:
Please convey my regards to the temple personnel.
Once I am mentally prepared, I would like to go and greet them.

column3: どうか貴方様も、それをお忘れなく
column4: Please do not forget that

column3:
あまりミューセルお姉様の手を
煩わせることはしないでね
column4: Please don't bother Suster Muselle too much

column3: 今は話しかけないでくれ
column4: Please don't talk to me right now

column3:
話しかけないでくれ
今の俺は憎悪の塊だぜ
column4:
Please don't talk to me.
I'm a bundle of hatred right now.

column3: どうぞご随意に――
column4: Please feel free to do as you wish—

column3: どうぞご随意に――
column4: Please feel free to help yourself――

column3: 助けてくれよぉ！
column4: Please help me!

column3: あんたたちも力を貸してくれ
column4: Please lend me your strength as well

column3:
具体的な話はジリアンから聞いてくれ
もちろんネド王子を尊重してくれよ
column4: Please listen to Gillian for the specific details. And of course, please respect Prince Nedo.

column3:
心して向かってください
ご武運をお祈りします
――覚者様のお戻りを信じておりますので！
column4: Please proceed with caution. We pray for your success. We believe in the return of the Arisen!

column3:
これだけは覚えておいてください
将軍は、悪い人ではありません
column4: Please remember this: The general is not a bad person.

column3: キースヒルト兄様をお願いします
column4: Please take care of Kieshildt.

column3: なにかお話ししてくださいな
column4: Please tell me something.

column3: 他の仲間が来るまで少々お待ちください――（仮）
column4: Please wait a moment until the rest of the group arrives.

column3:
待っていてくださいね
きっと――
きっと全部思い出しますから
column4: Please wait for me. I'm sure—I'll definitely remember everything.

column3:
パーティーリーダーが行き先を
選ぶまでお待ちください――
column4: Please wait for the party leader to choose the destination.

column3:
足元にお気を付けて
ここはとても――前が見えづらいので
column4: Please watch your step here, as it is very difficult to see ahead.

column3:
頼む、もっと部屋を明るくしてくれないか
暗闇に――
column4: Please, can you make the room brighter? In the dark...

column3: お仕事、頑張ってくださいな
column4: Please, do your best with your work.

column3: お願い――
column4: Please...

column3:
出撃の準備は整っています
しかし、まだ命令が届きませんのでね
column4: Preparations for deployment are complete. However, we have yet to receive orders.

column3:
ネド王子とは、将軍に連れられて
挨拶に行って――それだけ
column4: Prince Nedo and I were taken by the General to greet him—that's it.

column3:
ネド王子は貴君を慕っていると聞く
――なに、メガドでは有名なことだ
column4: Prince Nedo is said to adore you. What, it's a well-known fact in Megado.

column3:
ネド王子は前線に立って兵たちを
鼓舞するのが自分の責務だと
考えているみたい
column4: Prince Nedo seems to think that it is his duty to encourage the soldiers on the front line.

column3: ネド王子が我々と離れたがっている――
column4: Prince Nedo wants to leave us—

column3: ネド王子はいつか竜になるんだよね
column4: Prince Nedo will become a dragon someday.

column3:
ネド王子、守ってあげたくなっちゃう
小さな弟がいるのってこんな気分？
column4: Prince Nedo, I feel like I want to protect you. Is this what it's like to have a little brother?

column3:
ネド王子、王子らしくあろうとして
無理してる気がするんですけど
隊長、どう思います？
column4: Prince Nedo, I feel like he's trying to be more like a prince and forcing himself. Captain, what do you think?

column3:
ネド王子、気張りすぎじゃないのかい？
ありゃ、大丈夫かね
column4: Prince Nedo, aren't you trying too hard? Oh dear, are you okay?

column3: 王子とは必ず再会できる
column4: Prince's reunion is guaranteed.

column3: プィ？
column4: Pyi?

column3: キュッ　ピィ！
column4: Qee Pyi!

column3:
静かに、ギュッと――
覚悟を固めているのさ
column4: Quietly, firmly—I'm steeling my resolve.

column3:
近頃、騎士団に参加したい――
騎士になりたいという者が増えている
column4: Recently, more and more people want to join the Order—want to become knights.

column3:
最近はオークとの戦もごたついてるし
道具の需要も高くてな
流通が滞ったら大変だ
column4: Recently, there have been frequent battles with Orcs, and the demand for tools is also high. If the distribution is disrupted, it will be a big problem.

column3: 《原始の雫》とセシリーを頼んだよ
column4: Rely on the "Primeval Drops" and Cecily.

column3:
覚えていてほしい
取るに足りない――なんでもない――
そういうことが実は大きな意味を持っている
それに気づくのはね、大いなる喜びだよ
column4: Remember, insignificant—nothing—such things actually mean a great deal. It's a great joy to realize that, you know?

column3: それを忘れずに戦っておくれ
column4: Remember that and keep fighting.

column3: それを心に留め、この技を修得するがいい
column4: Remember that in your heart, you should strive to master this technique.

column3:
休める時には休む
これ、俺たちよく忘れちゃいますよね
column4: Rest when you can. We often forget this!

column3:
休める時には休む
これ、俺たちよく忘れちゃいますよね
column4: Rest when you can. We often forget this!

column3:
物品の本来の姿を取り戻す《レアアイテムの鑑定》
そして特定の効果を封じる《黒呪装具の効果封印》
どちらもわたしに心得がございます
column4: Restoring the original form of items, "Rare Item Appraisal," and sealing specific effects, "Bitterblack Equipment Effect Seal." I have knowledge of both.

column3: 笑止――
column4: Ridiculous...

column3:
今は呑んで――呑んで――
明日からちゃんとするからさ
column4: Right now, I'm drinking - drinking - I'll properly do it starting from tomorrow.

column3:
身を挺し、人々と竜を守る――
その覚悟こそが白衛騎士団の矜持だ
column4: Risking your life, protecting people and dragons. That determination is the pride of the White Knights.

column3: ロスギルはまだオークの襲撃を逃れていますよ
column4: Rothgill is still avoiding Orc attacks.

column3: うわさでは神殿の雰囲気が変わったのだとか
column4: Rumor has it that the atmosphere of the temple has changed.

column3: 風のように走り、雷のように刺す！
column4: Running like the wind, piercing like thunder!

column3:
走っても、戦っても、尽きない敵
ええ、やりがいがありますよ！
column4: Running, fighting, and endless enemies. Yes, it's challenging!

column3:
犠牲は大きかったが――
けして無駄にはならない
俺はそう信じている
column4: Sacrifices were made, but they were not in vain. I believe that.

column3:
こわいことや悲しいことは
もう起こらないんだよね？
column4: Scary and sad things won't happen anymore, right?

column3: また来週な！
column4: See you next week!

column3: また来週な！
column4: See you next week!

column3: また来週な！
column4: See you next week!

column3: また来週な！
column4: See you next week!

column3: ほら、僕の思った通りだろう？
column4: See, it's just as I thought, isn't it?

column3:
皆の楽しそうな顔を見てると
私も幸せな気持ちになってくるわ
こういう場があるって、大事だよね！
column4: Seeing everyone's happy faces makes me happy too. It's important to have a place like this!

column3:
以前、貴方が歩みを進めた場所まで
お送りしましょうか？
column4: Shall I send you back to where you once walked?

column3:
シッ――
あまり大きな声を出すな
column4: Shhhh—Don't speak too loudly.

column3:
盾もずっと持ってると重いんだよな
もうちょっと軽い盾を買えばよかったかなぁ
column4: Shields are also heavy when you hold them all the time. I guess I should have bought a lighter one.

column3: この辺りをもう少し調べていくか――
column4: Should I investigate this area a little further?

column3:
盗賊たちの受け入れ準備をした方が
よいのだろうか――
column4: Should we prepare to receive the bandits?

column3:
はぁ、少し休みたいわ
ここまで逃げてくるのに精一杯で――
column4: Sigh, I want to rest a little. I'm exhausted from running away this far.

column3: はぁ――あんたも懲りないわよね
column4: Sigh... You never learn, do you?

column3:
覚者になってからこっちずっとオークと
戦って鼻がバカになっちまったが
column4: Since I became an Arisen, I've been fighting Orcs all this time and now I'm getting all sniffly.

column3:
死ぬかもしれないんだから、スッキリして
おきたいけど――贅沢なのかな
column4: Since I might die, I want to feel refreshed, but is that being extravagant?

column3:
当のゴブリンが妙に楽しそうにしてるから
みんな何となく見て見ぬふりしてるよ
どうもキャリーに懐いてるみたいだし――
column4: Since the Goblin seems oddly happy, everyone is pretending not to see and just watching. It seems like he's attached to Carrie, so...

column3:
それを見ている人間が違うんだから
目に映る世界自体が違うと言えなくもないだろう
column4: Since the person looking at it is different, it could be said that the world itself that is reflected in the eyes is different.

column3:
協力してくれる人はまだまだ少ないので
わたしが父を探してあげないと――
column4: Since there are still very few people who are willing to help, I have to find my father myself...

column3:
復旧してから色んな人が来てくれるんだ
おかげで忙しくって、賑やかで
毎日やることだらけだよ
column4: Since we've been back up and running, we've had all kinds of people coming in. It's kept us busy and buzzing. There's so much to do every day!

column3:
ミューセルお姉様は、その、ちょっと――
考え事や調べ物に熱中されがちだから
わたしができることはお手伝いしてるの
column4: Sister Musel tends to be a bit—absorbed in her thoughts and research, so I try to help where I can.

column3:
技は一日にしてならず！
ひとつひとつ身に付けていくんだ
column4: Skill does not come in a day! You have to learn each one step by step.

column3:
だからこれからは、必ず、誰かと一緒に――
もちろん、みんなが知ってる誰かと一緒に
お出かけすることにして――
column4: So from now on, I'll be sure to go out with someone—of course, someone we all know—and—

column3: だからわたしは、あえてそこは目指さないの
column4: So, I intentionally won't aim for that.

column3:
というわけで、こんな言い方はらしくないが――
俺に任せてくれ
column4: So, although it may not be the most appropriate way to say it—Leave it to me.

column3:
つまりジッとしてるわけじゃねえ
厄介っちゃあ厄介だな
column4: So, it's not like I'm just sitting still. It's troublesome, that's for sure.

column3: 何だ、手短に頼む
column4: So, what do you want?

column3: さぁ、次はどうしようか
column4: So, what should we do next?

column3:
騎士団には売れるだけ恩を売っておけなんていう
覚者もいますけど、俺に言わせれば
持ちつ持たれつですよ
column4: Some Arisen believe in gaining favor with the knight order as much as possible, but in my opinion, it's all about mutual support.

column3:
ある者は、囚人に近付きすぎて
鼻をかじられたという噂もあるんだとか――
column4: Some people say they got their nose bitten by getting too close to the prisoner—

column3:
苦難の時代だなんて言うやつもいるけど
俺は結構楽しんでるよ
column4: Some say it's a hard time. I'm having a pretty good time.

column3:
いつか、覚者殿を加護する
白き竜の話を聞かせてくださいませんか？
とても長い時間を生きてきた竜だとか
column4: Someday, please tell us the story of the White Dragon that blesses the Lord of the Arisen. I hear it has lived a very long time.

column3:
なんとか街を守り切ったが――
こんなに攻め込まれるとは前代未聞だ
column4: Somehow we managed to protect the town, but it's unheard of to be invaded like this.

column3:
洞が時々、ふわっと輝くの
まるで何かが始まる予兆みたい
column4: Sometimes the cave's shining softly, as if it's a prelude to something starting.

column3:
時には強く言わないとね
もうお客さんじゃなくて、仲間なんだから
ダメなものはダメ
column4: Sometimes you have to say it strongly. You're not a customer anymore, you're a friend. What doesn't work doesn't work.

column3:
時々、セシリーが思い詰めた顔をしていますよ？
なんとかしてあげられませんかねえ
もう、見ていられませんよ
column4: Sometimes, Cecily has a troubled look on her face, you know? Can't we do something to help her? I can't bear to watch anymore.

column3:
すいません、今はこんな個人的な思いは
しまっておくべきですよね
column4: Sorry, I should probably put these personal thoughts away for now.

column3: 悪いけど、楽しく世間話する気分じゃないんだ
column4: Sorry, I'm just not in the mood for pleasant small talk.

column3: ごめんね、今手一杯なんだ――
column4: Sorry, I've got my hands full right now—

column3: 悪いが今は任務の途中だ
column4: Sorry, but I'm in the middle of a mission.

column3:
すまないけど、思ったより
土砂が詰まっててね
さすがに時間がかかってしまってるんだ
column4: Sorry, it's more packed with sediment than I thought. It's taking longer than expected.

column3:
すまない、想定より
時間がかかってしまっているんだ――（仮）
column4:
Sorry, it's taking
longer than expected

column3:
すまない、想定より
時間がかかってしまっているんだ――（仮）
column4:
Sorry, it's taking
longer than expected

column3:
すまない、想定より
時間がかかってしまっているんだ――（仮）
column4:
Sorry, it's taking
longer than expected

column3: 悪いね――
column4: Sorry---

column3:
すまん・・・
今週はワイらほかの工事で手いっぱいやねん。
column4:
Sorry...
We have our hands full with other construction this week.

column3:
すまん・・・
今週はワイらほかの工事で手いっぱいやねん。
column4:
Sorry...
We have our hands full with other construction this week.

column3:
すまん・・・
今週はワイらほかの工事で手いっぱいやねん。
column4:
Sorry...
We have our hands full with other construction this week.

column3:
すまん・・・
今週はワイらほかの工事で手いっぱいやねん。
column4:
Sorry...
We're really busy with other construction work this week.

column3: 厄介なことになりそうだねえ
column4: Sounds like it's going to be tricky.

column3:
ココだけの話、キャリーの飯って
とびきり美味いわけじゃないんだよな
column4: Speaking confidentially, Carrie's cooking isn't particularly delicious, you know.

column3:
監督といっても
お前たちはそれぞれの判断で
調査を進めてくれて構わん！
ジョゼフ様直々のお達しだ
column4: Speaking of the overseer, each of you can proceed with the investigation based on your own judgment! This is a direct order from Joseph himself.

column3:
それでも、王子のためなら
戦えるし、王子を思えば希望を抱ける
column4: Still, if it's for the prince, I can fight, and if I think of the prince, I can hold onto hope.

column3: やめろよ、今は話しかけるんじゃねぇよ
column4: Stop it, don't talk to me right now.

column3:
各地では異変が今日も起こっている
その原因は必ずあるはずなのだ
column4: Strange occurrences are happening everywhere today. There must be a definite cause for it.

column3: 耳障りな声だ
column4: Such an annoying voice.

column3: 物資補給も魔物討伐も終わりがみえんよ
column4: Supplies replenishment and enemy extermination have no end in sight.

column3: はいはい、何か売ってくれるのかい？
column4: Sure, are you here to sell something?

column3:
さぞ――いや、やめておこう
想像が当たったところでうれしくもなんともない
column4: Surely - No, let's leave it. Even if my imagination was correct, it wouldn't make me happy.

column3: 仲間を呼ばれる前に、確実に息の根を止めよう
column4: Take them out before they call their friends.

column3:
自分から盗賊に話しかけて
アンタにマズいことは無いのか？
column4: Talk to the bandit yourself. Is there anything wrong with you?

column3:
俺と話したって状況は何も変わらない
んなことは、わかってんだろう？
column4: Talking to me won't change anything about the situation. You understand that, right?

column3:
オマイと話だと？
ガハハハ、笑わせる！
column4: Talking to me? Gahahahaha, you make me laugh!

column3: チチッ！　チューッ！
column4: Tch! Tsh!

column3: チッ、雑魚どもめ
column4: Tch, you useless trash!

column3:
今度手柄話を聞かせてくれ
盛大にうらやましがってやろう
column4: Tell me your achievements next time. I'll celebrate them with great envy.

column3:
緊張は高まるばかりです
――ふぁぁ
column4: Tension is only growing. --whew!

column3:
皆さんお疲れさまでした
残りの人生を平穏に送れるように
わたしは日々祈るつもりです
column4: Thank you all for your hard work. I will pray every day that you have peace for the rest of your lives.

column3: 任務、ご苦労様です覚者様
column4: Thank you for your hard work, Arisen.

column3:
ありがとう！　助かったよ！
よしよしこれで――
column4: Thank you! I'm saved! Good job—

column3:
隊長さん、ありがとうございます
ここまで来られたのも隊長さんたちの
おかげです
column4: Thank you, Captain. It's thanks to you all that we've made it this far.

column3: 孫たちが世話になったね
column4: Thanks for taking care of the grandchildren.

column3:
ありがとう、少しの間動くなら
これで十分よ
column4: Thanks, if it works for a little while, this should be enough.

column3: レオの野郎――放って置いていいのか？
column4: That bastard Leo, can we afford to leave him alone?

column3: そうなったのは、10年くらい前からさね
column4: That has been the case since around 10 years ago.

column3: それが我々の覚悟だ
column4: That is our Arisen's resolve.

column3:
あの人は認めないでしょうけど
俺たち、結構、心が通じ合っているような
気がするんですよね
column4: That person might not admit it, but I feel like our hearts are somewhat connected, you know?

column3:
魔物を異形化させるアレ――
実は、我々もアレを発症する可能性があるらしい
あんな惨い姿にはなりたくないな――
column4: That thing that deforms demons—Actually, I heard that we can develop it too. I don't want to look that miserable—

column3: そりゃガキ大将の理屈じゃねえか
column4: That's a kid's theory, isn't it?

column3:
うれしいね
みんなにも声をかけてやってくれ
column4: That's great. Please speak to everyone and let them know.

column3: いいな、気は抜くなよ
column4: That's nice, don't let your guard down.

column3:
そうだ、お前にも話しておこう
この島に来て最初に調査することになった
《侵食魔の巣窟》の奥に
更なる空間が広がっていたのを覚えているか？
column4: That's right, I should tell you too. When I first came to this island, I was assigned to investigate the depths of the "Infected Den". Do you remember that there was a further expanse beyond it?

column3: そう――全ては巡る竜力で繋がっているのだ
column4: That's right—Everything is connected by the power of the dragons.

column3:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column4: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.

column3:
それを暴くのがわたしたちの
楽しみなんだけどさ
column4: That's what we're looking forward to uncovering.

column3:
そこで、お前に頼みたいというわけだ
調査に向かうタイミングは任せよう
準備ができたら、また声をかけてくれ！
column4: That's why I'm asking for your help. I'll leave it to you to decide when to head out to investigate. When you're ready, give me a call again!

column3: それで今の、聞き分けのいいあたしがいるのさ
column4: That's why I'm such a good listener now.

column3: あれ――
column4: That—

column3: 覚者のことは覚者が始末をつける――
column4: The Arisen has to take care of the Arisen's business.

column3:
アークでは、いや、参った――
でも、探せば珍品があったかもな
column4: The Ark, no, I give up—But if you look, there might be rare items.

column3:
黒騎士は難敵だよね――
闇雲に戦っても勝てないだろうなぁ
column4: The Black Knight is a formidable opponent, huh? I don't think you can win by fighting blindly.

column3:
予想以上に侵食が進んでいたことから
一旦は俺の判断で封鎖していたんだが
島全体の調査も進んできたことを考えて
そろそろ封鎖を解こうと思ってな
column4: The Corruption had progressed more than anticipated, so I temporarily sealed it off based on my judgment. However, considering that the investigation of the entire island has also progressed, I think it's about time to lift the blockade.

column3: 悪しき竜は憎き敵――国の仇です
column4: The Evil Dragon is a hated enemy - the nation's foe.

column3:
あとは“悪しき竜”だね
ちょっと遠回りしちまったけど
一歩一歩、追い詰めているはずだよ
column4: The Evil Dragon is the only thing remaining. Although we took a little detour; Step by step, we should be cornering it.

column3:
英霊眠りし道は普通のダンジョンとは異なります
ある程度の武具を揃えて挑まなければ
踏破は難しいのではと――
column4: The Heroic Spirit Sleeping Path is different from a normal dungeon. It may be difficult to conquer without equipping a certain level of weapons and armor.

column3:
騎士団は欠員が補充されて
ほっとひと息だ
column4: The Knights have filled the vacancy. It's a relief.

column3:
解放軍が明るくなったね
メイロワ将軍効果だね
column4: The Liberation Army has brightened up. It's the General Meirova effect.

column3:
解放軍もずいぶん減ってしまいましたから
いつも手一杯ですよ
でも、誰かがやらねば――
column4: The Liberation Army has dwindled down so much that we always have our hands full. But someone has to—

column3:
解放軍は少数精鋭
大軍の真っ向ぶつかり合いなど
考えちゃいない
column4: The Liberation Army is an elite few and they don't even think about the head-to-head clashes of large armies.

column3:
解放軍は再編成中さ
でもね、どんなに頑張ったって
あんたたちのいない穴は埋まらない
column4: The Liberation Army is regrouping but you know, no matter how hard we try we can't fill the hole without you guys.

column3:
オークはズールとかいう魔物と手を組んだ
このところ感じていた違和感の正体は
それだったようだ
column4: The Orc has formed an alliance with a creature called Zuhl. The true identity of the discomfort I had been feeling lately seems to be that.

column3:
騎士団は団結を尊ぶ――
では、“騎士団の団結”とは具体的には何だと思う
column4: The Order of the Knights values unity—So, what exactly do you think "the unity of the Order of the Knights" means?

column3:
王子はアッカーシェランのただひとりの
覚者なんだ
column4: The Prince is the only Arisen of Acre Selund.

column3:
その者が現れたことで王都は陥落したとか
いや、それ以上のことは知らないのですが
column4: The Royal Capital fell because of the appearance of that person, or so I've heard. Well, I don't know anything beyond that.

column3: 白竜様のご加護を！
column4: The White Dragon's blessing!

column3:
臨機応変に対処できるってのが
人間の一番の強みなんじゃないかな
column4: The ability to adapt to different situations is probably the greatest strength of a human, don't you think?

column3:
王子の不在が噂になり始めたよ
あんたらの耳にも入ると思うけど
放っておきな
column4: The absence of the prince has started to become a rumor, you know. But just leave it alone.

column3:
空気が汚れた感じがするよね
オークの攻撃臭が漂ってくるからかな
column4: The air feels polluted, doesn't it? Maybe it's because the stench of Orc attacks is lingering in the air.

column3:
空気がビリビリ震えているの――
これは良くないことのシルシなの――
column4: The air is tingling - This is the sign of something bad -

column3:
防具は種類により、装備できる部位が
決まっております
くれぐれもお買い間違えのないように
column4: The armor has different types, and the equipped parts are predetermined. Please be careful not to make any mistakes when making a purchase.

column3:
悪しき竜との決戦がすぐそこにあるのに
気になることが多すぎるの
column4: The battle against the Evil Dragon is right around the corner, but there are too many things that I'm worried about.

column3:
オークどもの行動様式が明らかに変化している
そちらも警戒を怠るなとレオとゲルト団長に
伝えてくれ
column4: The behavior patterns of the Orcs have clearly changed. Please also inform Captain Leo and Gerd to stay alert.

column3:
大食堂って壁に囲まれてるから
食料守るのには向いてるんだけど――
column4: The big dining hall is surrounded by walls, so it is suitable for protecting food, but...

column3:
白竜様よりお預かりした加護――
三たび、あなたが立ち上がるための
《復活力》としてお渡しいたします
column4: The blessing entrusted to you by Lord White Dragon—Once again, I bestow upon you the "Resurrection Power" in order for you to stand up once more.

column3:
流される血、消えない苦鳴――そうして手に入れた
安定、平和、繁栄を、よそから来た竜に乱され
黙っているわけにはいきません
column4: The blood that is spilled, the bitter cry that will not go away - that's how we got stability, peace, and prosperity, and we can't just sit back and let a dragon from another land disrupt it!

column3:
生死の境は、防具の質で決まると言っても
過言ではありません、どうかご留意ください
column4: The boundary between life and death is said to be determined by the quality of the armor, and this is not an exaggeration. Please keep this in mind.

column3:
大食堂、もうすっかり元通りだよ！　
――ううん、元の大食堂よりも良い感じかも
何ていったって皆で作り上げた食堂だからね！
column4: The cafeteria is back to normal now! No, it might even be better than before. After all, we all built this cafeteria together!

column3:
どの戦いでどのエリクシルを用いるかが
戦いの結果にも大きく影響するのだ
column4: The choice of which Elixirs to use in each battle greatly affects the outcome of the fight.

column3:
《原始の雫》を持ち去った犯人は
フィンダムがどうなっても構わない――
やっぱり、幾ら考えても気持がわからないな
column4: The culprit who took away《Primeval Drops》doesn't care what happens to Phindym after all— I still can't understand their feelings no matter how much I think.

column3:
瓦礫はまだ残ってるけどさ
食料庫が復活しただけで
力が湧いてくるんだぁ
column4: The debris is still there, but the pantry is back up and running. It gives me strength!

column3:
ここの守りは堅い――そういうことだ
思う存分、戦ってこい
column4: The defense here is strong—That's what I'm talking about. Go ahead and fight to your heart's content.

column3: 癒し手の需要は増える一方です
column4: The demand for healers continues to increase.

column3:
奥は侵食が進み
特に強力な侵食魔が巣食っていることは
まず間違いないだろう
column4: The depths have been corrupted, and there is no doubt that a powerful infected demon is nesting there.

column3:
荒廃した景色、それを見て己が心に
湧きあがるもの――
私はそれを見極めたい
column4: The devastated landscape, what wells up in my heart when I see it—I want to find out what it is.

column3:
王子の失踪は、ただの家出騒動では
ありません
column4: The disappearance of the prince is not a simple case of running away from home.

column3:
扉の先は《武神の間》――
仰々しい名前だろう
column4: The door is to the "War God Space"—I know that's an ostentatious name.

column3:
竜が倒された――
言ってしまえば、ただ一つの事件が
起こっただけで、この有様だ
column4: The dragon has been defeated—To put it simply, only one event has occurred, resulting in this state.

column3:
敵は我々が目一杯引きつけますから
ええ、派手にやりますとも
column4: The enemy will be completely occupied with us. Yes, we will be very flashy!

column3:
大切なものを守りたいっていう気持ちは
誰にだってあるものさ
失ってしまったら自分がどうなるかわからない
そんな大切なものが――
column4: The feeling of wanting to protect something important is something that everyone has. If we were to lose it, we wouldn't know what would become of ourselves. That's how precious it is -

column3:
覚者の気持ちは覚者にしかわからない
そう思っていたけど――
覚者同士でもわからないこと多いよね
column4: The feelings of an Arisen can only be understood by another Arisen, or so I thought... But even among Arisen, there are many things we don't understand.

column3:
理想はまずネド王子の保護だが
決戦と同時になっても良しとせねばなるまい
時は来たのだ
column4: The first priority is the protection of Prince Nedo, but we must also be prepared for the decisive battle. The time has come.

column3:
将軍が戻ってから流れが変わったな
そういう人なんだよ、あの人は
column4: The flow has changed since the general returned. That's the kind of person he is.

column3:
言葉の荒さも人の良さを隠すためのもの
まるでアッカーシェランの男のようにわかりやすい
column4: The harshness of words is also a means to conceal one's goodness, just like a man from Acre Selund, it is easy to understand.

column3:
魔物の増加は白竜の衰えと
確実に関係している
竜とは、いったい世界にとって何者のか――
column4: The increase of enemies is definitely related to the decline of the White Dragon. What exactly is a dragon to the world—?

column3: 長命のエルフが持つ知識は値千金――
column4: The knowledge that long-lived Elves possess is invaluable.

column3:
騎士団長はレオが手を抜いたと主張している
ということは――
column4: The leader of the knights claims that Leo slacked off which means—

column3:
展望城の城主はネド・アッカー様
そのことをオークどもに思い出させてやるわ
column4: The lord of Lookout Castle is Prince Nedo Acre. I will remind those Orcs of that.

column3: 魔物は増える一方だ
column4: The monsters keep increasing.

column3:
騎士団の士気は高いが、それでどうにか
なるわけでもなし――
何か他の道はないのか！
column4: The morale of the knight order is high, but that alone doesn't lead to anything—Isn't there any other way?

column3:
人数が増えると作戦の選択肢も増えるし
あなたたちの負担も減るからね
column4: The more people we have, the more operational options we have, and the less work you guys have to do.

column3:
次の作戦は――こっちでいくか
いやいや、逆にあっちの方が――
column4: The next strategy is...shall we go this way... No, the other way around is better...

column3: 魔物どもは増える一方だな
column4: The number of monsters is increasing.

column3: １人、３人と兵が増えていく
column4: The number of soldiers is increasing, one by one, and three by three.

column3:
今覚えてる場所は――
城の入り口と、王宮層と
あとはシチューのある食堂だけさ！
column4: The only places I remember now are—the castle entrance, the royal layer, and the cafeteria with the stew!

column3:
ここのところオークもおとなしいな
ずっとこうだといいのだが――
column4: The orcs have been quiet as of late, too. I wish it could be like this all the time—

column3:
魔赤島調査にかける熱意、そして実力――
どれをとっても抜きんでた働きだ！
今後も期待しているぞ！
column4: The passion and skills dedicated to the investigation of Bloodbane Isle are exceptional! We are expecting great things in the future!

column3: 扉の先は必ず展望城へと通じているはずです
column4: The path beyond the door must lead to Lookout Castle.

column3:
戦況は一進一退という認識は
間違いのようだな
column4: The perception that the war is going back and forth seems to be wrong.

column3:
わしの元に集められた“力”はまだ残っている
こいつでそこの扉を解放するとしよう
column4: The power gathered unto me still remains. Shall we open the door with this?

column3:
信じる力はとても大切だ
僕も信じているんだ
帰るべき場所――仲間の無事をね
column4: The power of belief is very important. I believe in it too. The place I should return to - the safety of my comrades.

column3:
王子は身も心も盗賊に染まってしまった――
なんてことはないよね？
column4: The prince became a bandit in body and soul... It's not true, right?

column3:
王子は気が触れたわけでも
心を奪われたわけでもない
となれば、わしの気持ちは決まっている
column4: The prince is neither crazy nor has he lost his mind. If that's the case, my feelings are already decided.

column3:
王子はまだまだ子供で頼りないけど
そのおかげで解放軍は一丸となる――
column4: The prince is still a child and unreliable, but thanks to that, the liberation army will unite as one.

column3:
まだ王子は幼いんだろ？
そうそう、ネド王子――
column4: The prince is still young, right? Yes, Prince Nedo—

column3:
王子はアッカーシェランの未来そのもの
なのですからね
column4: The prince is the future of Acre Selund, after all.

column3:
王子は重要人物には違いないけど
主人公は解放軍のひとりひとりだ
王子のことばかり思っちゃいられないさ
column4: The prince must be an important person, but the hero is one of the liberation army too. You can't think only about the prince.

column3:
王子は１２歳とか言ってたな
自分の頭で考えて行動できる年頃だ
column4: The prince said he was 12 years old; he should be old enough to think and act for himself.

column3:
王子は状況に屈することなく
積極的に動いているみたいだね
column4: The prince seems to be actively moving forward without succumbing to the circumstances.

column3:
王子の気持ち、わたしたちの気持ちが
どうあっても、選択肢はないよね
column4: The prince's feelings, our feelings, no matter what, there is no option.

column3:
王子の目的は恩人の盗賊ベルタを救うこと
その気持ちは大切にしないとね
column4: The prince's goal is to save his benefactor, the bandit Bertha. We must cherish that sentiment.

column3:
浄化はすでに始まっているのだが――
想像以上に時間がかかるようだ
column4: The purification has already begun - but it seems to be taking longer than anticipated.

column3:
隠れている同志を見つけ出すと同時に
不安な日々を送ってきた人々に
僕たちが来ていることを知らせる目的もあります
column4: The purpose is to find our comrades in hiding and at the same time to let those who have been living in uncertainty know that we are coming!

column3:
“悪しき竜”の目的が自分の力を
誇示するためとは――
column4: The purpose of the "Evil Dragon" is to demonstrate their own power.

column3:
調査の成果が出始めているな
厳しい状況に変わりはないが
この調子で進めていこう
column4: The results of the investigation are beginning to show, but the situation remains severe. Let's continue in this way.

column3: 王家の威光もあまり届いていないとか
column4: The royal family's authority does not seem to reach very far.

column3:
アッカーシェランのオークの匂いは
また独特――新鮮な気分で戦えるぜ
column4: The scent of Acre Selund's Orcs is unique; it makes you feel refreshed and ready to fight.

column3:
勝利の秘策？
そんなものがあるなら、そもそも戦争など起こらない
column4: The secret strategy for victory? If such a thing exists, wars wouldn't happen in the first place.

column3:
盾は、身を守るだけのものではないぞ
使いようによっては敵の攻撃をいなし
反撃の足掛かりとすることもできる
column4: The shield is not just for self-defense. Depending on how it is used, it can block the enemy's attacks and serve as a foothold for counterattacks.

column3:
ちょっとばかりマズい状況になってきてな
“侵食”の進行スピードがこちらの予想を
上回っているようだ――
column4: The situation is becoming a bit troublesome. The speed of Corruption seems to be surpassing our expectations.

column3:
精霊竜ウィルミアは美しく愛らしい竜だ
今でも目を閉じると、優雅に飛ぶ姿が目に浮かぶ
column4: The spirit dragon Willmia is a beautiful and lovely dragon. Even now, when I close my eyes, I can see its graceful flying figure.

column3:
ここの連中の頭の固さはジョゼフ以上だが
悪い気はしねえな
連中なりに筋が通っている
column4: The stubbornness of these people here is greater than Joseph's, but I don't feel bad about it. They have their own way of doing things.

column3:
本日はお日柄もよく――
って、何を言っているんだ、俺は
column4: The sun is shining today—What am I saying, I'm not...

column3: 私がいた村は侵食に飲み込まれて――
column4: The village I was in has been corrupted...

column3:
入り江に響くのは数えきれない魔物たちの声
そして覚者たちの叫び――
column4: The voices of countless monsters echo in the inlet, as well as the cries of the Arisen—

column3:
入り江に響くのは数えきれない魔物たちの声
そして覚者たちの叫び――
column4: The wind is blowing—This is a tailwind—oh, I can feel it.

column3:
風が吹いてきた――
これは追い風だ――ああ、感じるぞ
column4: The words of Master White Dragon—I cannot let even a single word pass me by.

column3:
白竜様の言葉――
ひと言も聴き逃すわけにはいかんな
column4: The world you see and the world I see might be different.

column3:
お前の見ている世界と
俺の見ている世界は違うかもしれないぜ
column4: Then don't hesitate, come here anytime.

column3: ならば遠慮せず、いつでもここに来い
column4: Then you don't need to hold back. Please go wild outside the fortress.

column3:
だったら遠慮はいらない
砦の外でひと暴れしてきてくれ
column4: Then you should at least become a 《Fighter》 and have at least 18 job levels of experience.

column3:
なら少なくとも《ファイター》となり
ジョブレベル１８以上の経験を
積むことだな
column4: Then, let us send you to the past. Oh, Arisen of the White Dragon, may fortune favor you.

column3:
それでは、過去へとお送りしましょう
白き竜の覚者よ、どうかご武運を――
column4: There are many things I would like to learn by your side, Lord.

column3: 本当なら、そばで学びたいことがたくさんあるのだが
column4: There are many things that I need to discuss with the prince. I can't afford to rest just yet.

column3:
王子と相談して決めねばねばならんことが
多々あるのだ
まだまだ休むわけにはいかない
column4:
There are many things that I need to discuss with the prince.
I can't afford to rest just yet.

column3: 同志に向ける武器はない――
column4: There are no weapons for comrades-in-arms -

column3:
覚者のことを便利屋みたいに
思ってる奴、いるよな――
column4: There are people who think of Arisen as a handyman, right?

column3:
聞きたいことが山ほどある
そんな顔だね
column4: There are so many things I want to ask. That's the kind of expression you have.

column3:
まだまだ行った事のない洞窟や遺跡は
たくさんあるのよね
column4: There are still plenty of caves and ruins that I have never been to, you know.

column3:
異変はそこかしこで起こっている
私はそれを探求していてね
レスタニア中を巡っている
column4: There are strange occurrences happening everywhere I am investigating them, you know. Traveling throughout Lestania.

column3:
アークから戻らなかった部下がいるのだ
やりきれんな――
column4: There are subordinates who did not return from the Ark. I can't stand it—

column3:
気になることはいろいろあるけれど
先に解放軍の目的を果たさなくちゃね
column4: There are various things that I am concerned about, but first, I have to accomplish the objective of the Liberation Army.

column3:
ここにはもう何もなさそうだ
僕の勘がそう囁いているのでね
さて、帰るとしよう！
column4: There doesn't seem to be anything else here. That's what my instincts are whispering to me, you know. Well, let's go home!

column3: ここにはもう何もなさそうだ
column4: There doesn't seem to be anything here anymore.

column3:
これまで幾つもの戦いがあったが――
騎士団と覚者がこれほど協力し合って
事にあたったことはなかったんじゃないかな
column4: There have been many battles so far, but the Knights and the Arisen cooperating like this, I don't think it has ever happened before.

column3:
西の方に水量の多い洞窟があってな
恐らくあそこが辺り一帯の
水源になってるんだろう
column4: There is a cave with a lot of water to the west. It is likely that it is the source of water in this area.

column3:
橋を渡ったところに大きな坑道跡があるのは
もう知っているか？
column4: There is a large mine site across the bridge. Do you already know about it?

column3:
ダナ村ってところがあってな、
そこらへんで採れる野菜は味が濃くてウマイ！
なんというか、力強い味だ
column4: There is a place called Dana Village. The vegetables that grow around there have a rich and delicious taste! It's kind of like a strong and powerful flavor.

column3:
世界は一つではない――
こう聞いた時、お前は何を思う？
column4: There is more than one world. What do you think when you hear this?

column3: こちらは異常ありません！
column4: There is no abnormality here!

column3:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください
column4: There is no problem here. Please serve Prince Nedo.

column3:
こちらは問題ありませんよ
ネド王子のお側に仕えてください
column4: There is no problem here. Please serve Prince Nedo.

column3:
有用な情報は――
いまのところ、無い
column4: There is no useful information at the moment.

column3:
話してやれることなんか
特に無いんだよな――
column4: There is nothing in particular that I can do -

column3: 最早、話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3: 話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3: 話すことなどない
column4: There is nothing to say anymore.

column3: まだまだ、研究すべきことは多いな――
column4: There is still much to research,

column3: きっと、何かあるはずさ
column4: There must be something for sure.

column3: きっと、何かあるはずさ
column4: There's got to be something.

column3: もう進むしかない
column4: There's no choice but to move forward.

column3:
言うまでもねえが、俺は単純にガシガシと
戦うのが好きだ
column4: There's no need to say it, but I simply love a grueling fight.

column3: お前と個人的に話すような話題は無いな
column4: There's no personal topic I would talk to you about.

column3:
焦っても仕方がないよね
――そう自分に言い聞かせてるよ
column4: There's no point in rushing -- that's what I keep telling myself.

column3:
訓練にやりすぎはないぞ
じっくり実戦前に稽古していけ！
column4: There's no such thing as too much training. Take your time and practice before the actual battle!

column3:
瓦礫だらけでホコリっぽいし
できたら空気、入れ替えたいけど――
column4: There's rubble everywhere and it's dusty. I'd like to change the air if I could, but--

column3:
まだまだやることはあるんでしょう？
くじけていられないわよね
column4: There's still a lot to do, right? I can't afford to be discouraged.

column3:
レスタニアには白竜さまがいらっしゃいます
それに覚者さまも――
column4: There's the White Dragon in Lestania and the Arisen—

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3: こう魔物が増えちゃ、たまらないな
column4: These enemies are multiplying, it's really overwhelming.

column3:
おいしいごはん作ってくれることもあれば――
大事なもの何もかも奪ってくことだってあるし
column4: They can cook you a delicious meal, or they can-- take away everything that's important to you.

column3:
おばあちゃんはいつか帰れるっていうけど
ホントかな――
column4: They say grandma will come home someday. I wonder if that's true—

column3: 教えてくれるで！
column4: They'll tell you!

column3: 教えてくれるで！
column4: They'll tell you!

column3: 教えてくれるで！
column4: They'll tell you!

column3: 教えてくれるで！
column4: They'll tell you!

column3:
良い子なんですけどね
あれで中々しっかりしているんですよ
column4: They're a good kid, though. They're quite reliable with that.

column3: 盗賊ってのはどこにでもいるからな
column4: Thieves are everywhere.

column3:
この《黒呪の迷宮》は生きる島
島の蠢きにより強力な宝物が生み出されます
覚者様のお目に適う物があれば
わたしが協力いたしましょう
column4: This "Bitterblack Maze" is a living island. Powerful treasures are created by the island's movements. If there is something suitable for the Arisen to see, I will assist you.

column3:
この魔赤島調査隊は精鋭揃いだ
難しい任務ではあるが、士気も高い
――俺か？　俺も久しぶりに勇み立ってるな！
column4: This Bloodbane Isle expedition team is comprised of elite members. Although it is a difficult mission, their morale is high. ――As for me? I'm also feeling a surge of courage after a long time!

column3: この大食堂って、かなり期待されてるんだね
column4: This Cafeteria, it's been highly anticipated.

column3:
難攻不落と思われたこの城も
あっさりと“悪しき竜”に落とされた
その口惜しさが、わしの原動力だ
column4: This fortress, which was thought to be impregnable, was easily taken down by the "Evil Dragon." The frustration of that defeat is my driving force.

column3: これは危険な兆候だよ
column4: This is a dangerous sign.

column3:
これはなんとも歯がゆい状況だな
え？
column4: This is a very frustrating situation, isn't it?

column3:
これも広い意味で白竜様をお守りする
覚者ならではの戦いですから
column4: This is also a battle in the broad sense of protecting the White Dragon, that only the Arisen can fight.

column3:
これも、“土地の記憶”が
正常に戻ってきた証左と言えましょう
column4: This is also evidence that the 'memory of the land' has returned to normal.

column3:
これも縁ってやつだ
大食堂が完全に復旧するまで協力するよ
column4: This is also fate. I'll help until the big dining hall is fully restored.

column3: これは覚者様――！
column4: This is an Arisen—

column3: ――これは、独り言じゃないよね？
column4: This isn't just talking to myself, right?

column3: これは食べられそうだね！
column4: This looks edible!

column3:
本来は交わることのない世界の交錯により
姿を現してしまった迷宮
column4: This maze appeared as a result of the collision of worlds that should never have intersected.

column3:
本来は交わることのない世界の交錯により
姿を現してしまった迷宮
column4: This maze appeared as a result of the collision of worlds that should never have intersected.

column3: ここはすでに工事済みやで！
column4: This place is already under construction!

column3: ここはすでに工事済みやで！
column4: This place is already under construction!

column3: ここはすでに工事済みやで！
column4: This place is already under construction!

column3: ここはすでに工事済みやで！
column4: This place is already under construction!

column3:
この剣は王家へ捧げたもの！
今に名を残す英雄のように
それは勇ましく振るってみせよう
column4: This sword is dedicated to the royal family! Just like the renowned hero who will be remembered, let's swing it valiantly.

column3:
腕によりをかけて作った武器だよ
きっちり売ってやらないと
column4: This weapon was created with great skill. I won't sell it unless I get a good price.

column3:
侵食魔が噴き出しているあの“胞子”――
あまり吸い込まないようにした方がいいわ
column4: Those "spores" of the corrupting demon are erupting— It's better not to inhale them too much.

column3:
義賊みたいなやつらかそれとも
ただの山賊集団か――
column4: Those guys are like noble thieves, or maybe just a group of bandits—

column3:
あの人たち戦闘中はガツガツするから
調子を乱されちゃうんだ
column4: Those people are too aggressive during combat, so it throws off my rhythm.

column3:
あそこにいる二人もそうで
修理をお願いしてるところさ
column4: Those two over there are also asking for repairs.

column3:
戦える者が戦わねばならん
こんなところで膝をつくわけには――
column4: Those who can fight must fight. We can't just fall to our knees here—

column3:
過去を軽んじる者は、未来に泣くことになる
いつの時代も、そういうものさ
column4: Those who dismiss the past will weep in the future. It's always been like that, no matter the era.

column3:
真っ直ぐに進む人は
大切なことを忘れがちです
覚者さん、気をつけてね
column4: Those who proceed straight ahead tend to forget important things. Arisen one, be cautious.

column3: 少し休ませろって話だ
column4: Time for a rest.

column3: 時は――少し、意地悪です
column4: Time is-- harsh.

column3:
こうして再び展望城に立つことができるとは――
感慨無量です
column4: To be able to stand in Lookout Castle again like this ―― it's an indescribable feeling.

column3:
正直に言って、興味本位は困る
これからのわたしの立場もあるからね
column4: To be honest, I'm troubled by curiosity for curiosity's sake. Because it also involves my future position, you know.

column3:
正直言って、覚者の中にあんたがいるのは
助かるよ
column4: To be honest, it's reassuring that you're one of the Arisen.

column3: 正直に言って――胸がおどるよ
column4: To be honest... my heart is pounding.

column3: 竜として生まれ変わってな
column4: To be reborn as a dragon.

column3:
あなたにもパメラにもジョゼフ様にも
心配をかけちゃって――
column4: To both you and Pamela and Master Joseph, I apologize for causing you worry...

column3: 手短にな
column4: To make it brief.

column3:
さらに仲間との冒険が楽しくなるように
わたしからの贈り物だ
受け取っておくれ！
column4: To make your adventures with your friends even more enjoyable, here is my gift to you. Please accept it!

column3:
己自身を見つめ直すため
戦に乱れた各地を行脚しておるのです
column4: To reflect on oneself, I am wandering around various places that have been disturbed by war.

column3:
竜の敵となりうるおそろしき魔を退けるには
手に持つ刃もまた、特別でなければなりません
column4: To repel the fearsome demons that can become enemies of the dragon, the blades we wield must also be special.

column3:
過去のアッカーシェランへは
私がお送りいたしましょう
しかし、私ができるのはそこまで――
あとは、貴方の力に懸けるほかありません
column4: To the past Acre Selund, I will send you myself. However, my capabilities only go so far - The rest is up to your own strength.

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜様あってこそだ
column4: Today exists because of The White Dragon exists.

column3:
昨日と違う今日、今日と違う明日――
世界はその繰り返しでできてるんだ
――てな
column4: Today is different from yesterday, and tomorrow will be different from today―― The world is made up of such repetitions ―― That's what it means.

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon

column3: 今日があるのも、白竜さまのおかげだよ
column4: Today's existence is also thanks to The White Dragon
